text.0: agni lifepower and fame are thine thy fires blaze mightily thou rich in wealth of beams.
text.1: sage passing bright thou givest to the worshipper with strength the food that merits laud.
text.2: with brilliant purifying sheen with perfect sheen thou liftest up thyself in light.
text.3: thou visiting both thy mothers aidest them as son thou joinest close the earth and heaven.
text.4: o jātavedas son of strength rejoice ihyself gracious in our fair hymns and songs.
text.5: in thee are treasured various forms of strengthening food born nobly and of wondrous help.
text.6: agni spread forth as ruler over living things give wealth to us immortal god.
text.7: thou shinest out from beauty fair to look upon thou leadest us to conquering power.
text.8: to him the wise who orders sacrifice who hath great riches un der his control.
text.9: thou givest blest award of good and plenteous food givest him wealth that conquers all.
text.10: the men have set before them them for their welfare agni strong visible to all the holy.
text.11: thee godlike one with ears to hear most famous mens generations magnify with praisesongs.
